item.title: Unit of Work (UoW) in Python with SQLAlchemy: explicit transactions, savepoints, and outbox
item.description: How I designed an asynchronous, scalable UoW with SQLAlchemy: explicit transaction boundary, nesting with savepoints, transactional outbox, idempotency, and a manager that works across API, CLI, and workers.

item.title: Longest Common Prefix: Five Algorithms Compared
item.description: Explore five different strategies to solve LeetCode 14 - Longest Common Prefix, complete with benchmarks, complexity analysis, and guidance on choosing the optimal approach.

item.title: From Spreadsheets to Scripts: My Journey Automating Accounting with Python
item.description: Discover how the Python language can transform repetitive accounting processes into efficient, automated, and error-free workflows.

item.title: Roman to Integer â€” Clean, Fast, and Functional Approaches Compared
item.description: LeetCode 13 â€” Parsing Roman numerals in Python using a clean single-pass solution and a functional overengineered version. Benchmarks and complexity included.

item.title: Is It a Palindrome Number? Three Ways to Solve It Without Converting to String
item.description: I explore three different approaches to check if an integer is a palindrome â€” from the most direct solution to a mathematical reversal without string conversion.

item.title: About
item.description:
Hi, I’m Frederico Gago, a passionate software developer dedicated to crafting solutions that transform complexity into clarity. I specialize in Python 3.13, Clean Architecture, SOLID principles, and thoughtful design patterns, driven by the belief that great software should feel intuitive, empowering, and elegant.

My mission is to redefine the way professionalsâ€”especially in accounting and financeâ€”interact with their daily tasks. By automating routine processes and eliminating friction, I aim to help people reclaim their focus and creativity, enabling them to achieve more meaningful and impactful outcomes.
